page.title: 15FOOTPATH WALKS
page.content: The Swillington area has a good network of footpaths which provide interesting walks through woodland, open farmland and areas of industrial activities. At the present time there are{26} {public rights of way}although some of these have been affected by farming, opencast mining, quarying activities and housing development.These footpaths are walked regularly by two senior citizens who report any obtructions, etc., to the Parish Council. There have been cases recenty of local farmers ploughing up little used footpaths and coming into conflict with the Ramberlers Association. A section of the{Leeds {Country Way,}a 60 mile recreational footpath around Leeds completed in 1982, passes through the area.
